alert.note: Alert for Coconino Plateau; Grand Canyon Country; Kaibab Plateau; Western Mogollon Rim; Yavapai County Mountains (Arizona) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Winter Weather Advisory issued December 10 at 2:07PM MST until December 12 at 5:00PM MST by NWS Flagstaff
info.description: ...WINTER WEATHER ADVISORY IN EFFECT FROM LATE SUNDAY NIGHT THROUGH MONDAY AFTERNOON ABOVE 5000 FEET... * WHAT...Heavy snow possible above 5000 feet. Total snow accumulations of 2 to 8 inches possible. Portions of the San Francisco Peaks could see snow totals as great as 12 inches. Winds could gust as high as 40 mph. * WHERE...Areas above 5000 feet near Doney Park, Flagstaff, Grand Canyon, Jacob Lake, North Rim, Prescott, Prescott Valley, Seligman, Valle and Williams. * WHEN...From late Sunday night through Monday afternoon. * IMPACTS...Travel could be very difficult. Patchy blowing snow could significantly reduce visibility. The hazardous conditions could impact the morning or evening commute. Snow forecast from 11 PM Sunday to 5 PM Monday: Doney Park 3 to 5 inches Flagstaff 4 to 8 inches Grand Canyon 3 to 5 inches Jacob Lake 2 to 4 inches North Rim 4 to 6 inches Prescott 2 to 4 inches Prescott Valley 0 to 1 inches Seligman 1 to 3 inches Valle 3 to 5 inches Williams 4 to 8 inches
info.instruction: Slow down and use caution while traveling. The latest road conditions for the state you are calling from can be obtained by calling 5 1 1.

area.areaDesc: Coconino Plateau; Grand Canyon Country; Kaibab Plateau; Western Mogollon Rim; Yavapai County Mountains
